laboratory_examinations.findings: The liver is diffusely echogenic, suggestive of fatty infiltration. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. The gallbladder contains several stones lodged in the fundus. There is no sonographic sign. No pericholecystic fluid or gallbladder wall thickening is seen. The common duct is not dilated and measures 0.3 cm in diameter. No free fluid seen.
